column1: As the months have passed it can feel that America’s collective appreciation for the same work has waned that the tedious nature of combatting a pandemic has dulled our vigor or that we are suffering from “COVID fatigue.”
Amazing work happening in Waukegan building the Coronavirus-killing robots that will help us get through this pandemic.  https://t.co/M1nuC2cF5O

Tackling COVID-19 must be our top priority and President-Elect Joe Biden has made it his first step in the transition.   This is leadership that is prepared to crush the virus revive our economy and build America back better on day one.  https://t.co/wPYj5YejTe
This is great news for all Americans in the long fight against COVID-19.  As we move closer to a vaccine it’s more important than ever that we don’t let down our guard.  https://t.co/5XW7IFvKfI

Open Enrollment begins today and runs through Dec. 15.  During this COVID pandemic having access to affordable quality health coverage is more important than ever. Don’t go uncovered. Go to https://t.co/a2pvMrWqyB and find a quality affordable plan that works for you.

Conrad 30 doctors help communities in every state combat COVID-19. The Trump Administration’s proposed visa changes threaten to gut this critical public health program in the middle of a global pandemic. With dozens of Members joining I told DHS we oppose these dangerous changes https://t.co/SM1HlbLafK
In Illinois like most of the country we’re contracting more COVID cases than ever.   https://t.co/p1cfUrP4Fb

Qualifying Cook County constituents can get a one-time $600 payment for COVID assistance.  If you have experienced hardship due to unpaid leave care for vulnerable or infected relatives or loss of wages due to business or school closures please apply:  https://t.co/FJeLzJgPnU

There is no doubt our country’s health care system is stronger because of the ACA. More than 130 million Americans have pre-existing condition protections. And that number will only grow because of COVID.  @ASlavitt told us that Americans want bipartisan protection of the ACA. https://t.co/mAOPr0SxDA

As Illinois experiences our highest single-day totals of positive cases the Illinois Department of Public health is offering free COVID-19 testing in Wauconda Fox Lake Libertyville and Vernon Hills over the next week. https://t.co/fdGawVnY8z

Instead of working on a second round of Covid relief today Senate Republicans focused on rushing through a SCOTUS confirmation to dismantle the Affordable Care Act.  The nation is crying out for help and they are focused on themselves.  https://t.co/CNd9OPQnMf

The United States has hit its highest daily coronavirus rate in two months. You can find reliable information and resources for local COVID-19 guidance from county health officials:   LAKE: https://t.co/MiTDxMW5Jy  COOK: https://t.co/DFZrMX5iwU
I wish a full recovery for President Trump the First Lady Hope Hicks and everyone else affected by the COVID-19 outbreak within the White House.

These are the ideas that lie behind the COVID Prepare Act. This is bipartisan commonsense legislation crafted with my friend John Katko to assure the American people that their federal government is fully prepared to address this ever-changing public health and economic crisis

Today the House passed my bipartisan COVID PREPARE Act on a unanimous voice vote.   With the timeline for rolling out a safe and effective vaccine still unknown it is imperative that the government develop and implement comprehensive strategies... https://t.co/CEGd45NNHG

Hispanic Heritage Month runs Sept. 15 to Oct. 15 and is a special reminder of our essential and resilient Latino community in Illinois. In the middle of this pandemic we must work to protect Latino lives currently disproportionately affected by Covid-19.  #HispanicHeritageMonth

If you or a loved one is struggling with substance use or mental health disorders there are resources available to help.   COVID-19 has made almost everything harder. I’m wearing purple to say no one is alone in this fight #RecoveryMonth   https://t.co/4CfZPWtowE https://t.co/TW3IHX3EqX

I will continue to fight these efforts every step of the way. Critically the House included $25 billion in help for the USPS in the Heroes Act back in May. Instead of helping us defend this institution the Senate went home without passing a COVID-relief bill.

I spent the day traveling the district seeing GiveNKind and local leaders in Buffalo Grove Lake Bluff Zion and Winthrop Harbor.   Our local communities are each facing unique challenges during this COVID crisis. https://t.co/215nJcjH9m
It was good to be on WGN's Sunday Political Report to discuss the importance of passing a Covid relief package like the Heroes Act to tackle this virus and reopen our economy. https://t.co/G26ZPyQsQD

In my district our packages and mail have been delayed recently. In this moment during COVID the President and his new Postmaster General are trying to dismantle the US Postal Service by cutting back on services.  https://t.co/OZrq4Z3lQq

Congress can work in a bipartisan way.   The COVID PREPARE Act - introduced last month to prepare for a potential resurgence this fall - got bipartisan support from The Problem Solvers Caucus 25 Democrats and 25 Republicans.  It only takes leadership.   https://t.co/Me2k3iFfh7

It didn’t have to be this way.    The Trump administration’s failings in responding to the COVID-19 pandemic has already cost the country more than 150000 lives with millions more affected by the health impacts.  https://t.co/dASWAjjg70

The science is clear: masks prevent the spread of the Coronavirus. If all of us are wearing masks we’re protecting each other.   On one hand it’s simple common courtesy. On the other hand it’s our responsibility.  #OnWednesdaysWeWearPink #WearAMask https://t.co/yr8GqqCgyF

The HEROES Act that we passed two months ago would send more checks extend unemployment aid add testing and form State and Local Coronavirus Relief Funds to help out Illinois and cities like Chicago and Waukegan.

Everyone should be watching the 3 W's: Wear a mask watch your distance and wash your hands. Illinois has been doing great work so far we can't let up now.   These kinds of resurgences are why I announced my bipartisan COVID PREPARE Act this week.  https://t.co/gE5TmQSgwz

The COVID-19 pandemic has been particularly challenging for small businesses which is why I continue to implore our local firms to get the help they need. Applications open tomorrow morning for Lake County's new small business assistance grants.  https://t.co/UyvG30vj9v
Sending my best wishes to Attorney General Raoul for a full and speedy recovery from Covid-19. https://t.co/X5e2h6fuMC

Community Partners for Affordable Housing is accepting applications for rental and utility assistance for those whose income has been affected by COVID-19. Assistance is available for as many as 3 months up to $1500/month. More information at: https://t.co/XQet1IZMgf

Contract tracers will only call you in the instance that you may have come into contact with someone diagnosed with COVID-19 and should consider getting tested. For updated COVID-19 information please visit the IDPH's website: https://t.co/spWwQX6PUH

We've heard reports that some scammers are posing as COVID-19 contact tracers. The Illinois Department of Public Health (IDPH) is clear that no legitimate contact tracer will ever ask for payment or a person’s Social Security number.

The #COVID-19 pandemic has disproportionately affected people’s health in communities of color. In the first virtual hearing of @WaysMeansCmte we’re discussing this important topic. Watch the hearing on the causes of this disparity and possible solutions: https://t.co/uisP3kxhQk

T I am fighting to ensure USPS has the resources it needs to continue service through the Covid-19 pandemic. Postal funding was one our priorities in the Heroes Act that already passed the House - now it's time for the Senate to act! https://t.co/bDhq8L0Mdb

The Covid-19 pandemic is putting additional strain on our already overstretched mental health care system.   We have to end the stigma and invest in mental health services so all Americans can access the care they need. https://t.co/nRofP1WYZr

Hate is hate and must be never be left unanswered. As we fight to beat back the Covid-19 virus there is ample room for debate but there is never room for hate bigotry or antisemitism. https://t.co/lKGmTqBdcL
The scale of the coronavirus crisis requires big and bold action to protect the lives and livelihoods of the American people.  https://t.co/SYklye4Ytn

Our health care providers are being stretched to the breaking point by the Covid-19 pandemic. Today I'm introducing legislation to fix a federal loan program so they can access relief during this pandemic.  https://t.co/w9T6Gjkhyq

My sincere condolences to the family and loved ones of former Highland Park Mayor Raymond Geraci who passed away due to Covid-19 complications earlier this month. We will remember his love for his community and the many ways he gave back. https://t.co/NK48u2988N

The Healthcare Workforce Resilience Act would reallocate 40000 unused visas for physicians and nurses. The strong bipartisan bicameral support for this bill shows it is a common sense response to the Covid-19 pandemic and I urge all my colleagues to join our effort.

The Covid-19 pandemic is making the shortage of doctors and nurses facing many cities and towns even worse. Today I introduced bipartisan legislation to enable more immigrant health care professionals to meet the needs of our communities. https://t.co/YyNNjeA4t9

Unbelievable. Health care workers are still facing shortages of PPE and we desperately need a national testing strategy. Now is not the time to be winding down the Coronavirus Task Force.  https://t.co/w7xZFQZXkK

It's critical Dr. Fauci is able to testify in the House as we seek expert guidance to ensure we are providing the resources needed to fight COVID-19.   A pandemic is no time for partisan politics. https://t.co/sT5PK4NTIa

Thank you Isabella (age 5) from Glenview for sending in this note thanking our doctors and nurses!   You can send in a copy of your note thanking essential workers on the frontlines of the Covid-19 pandemic here: https://t.co/aZ6Ou2tMC5 https://t.co/db4Di8NpTl
I'll be going live on Friday at 12pm CT to share an update on our efforts to address the Covid-19 pandemic and answer your questions.   📺Tune in here: https://t.co/mI1BuFc8EM

Congress has to do more to support our states and localities stretched thin on the frontlines of the Covid-19 crisis.  Glad to partner with @RepJohnKatko @RepTjCox @RepPeteKing & @RepDianaDeGette on this bipartisan effort.

Still waiting on your coronavirus Economic Impact Payment? The IRS has now updated their site so most taxpayers can track the status of their payment and view the scheduled delivery date by direct deposit or mail. https://t.co/lz7BPTdumi

Glad there is growing support for a centralized federal authority to coordinate COVID-19 medical supply chain issues for both PPE and testing equipment.   I led two dozen colleagues calling for Administration to appoint a supply chain czar last month.   https://t.co/emsqsu9IiL

Words of wisdom and hope from Capt. James Lovell:  “Apollo 13 turned out to be a success after all” Lovell said adding “I hope that the COVID-19 virus (crisis) is also going to end successfully."  https://t.co/hY2u9tvxpC

The racial disparities in the rate of infection and death by COVID-19 are deeply concerning. In Chicago African-Americans comprise around 30 percent of the population but account for more than 64 percent of coronavirus deaths.

My Illinois Democratic colleagues and I are calling on the CDC to begin publicly publishing national data on coronavirus demographics so we can better understand this problem and act to protect the health of communities of color. https://t.co/izMqG2uU7P

We can’t get ahead of the battle to beat back the coronavirus if we don’t have adequate wide-spread testing in virtually every American community. Too many broken promises from the Trump Administration. https://t.co/WFcH8SAwqq
The coronavirus knows no boundaries and we cannot allow a slow federal response to leave our smaller municipalities and local governments behind.

Small businesses need all the assistance and flexibility we can provide to withstand and recover from this crisis.  I’ll continue to fight to keep Main Street business owners at the top of Congress’ priorities during the #COVID19 pandemic. https://t.co/cdB4KmQJj3
Looking for information on how the CARES Act expands eligibility for unemployment insurance during the COVID-19 crisis? Answers to commonly asked questions are below. https://t.co/Ilb9sdu134

The economic challenges caused by the coronavirus are daunting enough. It would be a help to many middle class families in Illinois to remove the threat of double taxation due to the caps on the State and Local Tax Deduction.

I was proud to help lead the House bill to repeal these  punishing caps on the State and Local Tax Deduction (SALT) in December and will continue fighting to include this provision to provide needed stimulus and relief in any future coronavirus package. https://t.co/fZgIVCGb6m

With the coronavirus we are experiencing the consequences of an Administration failing to take seriously the warnings of experts and prepare. President Trump continues to chart the same path of dangerous ignorance on the climate crisis. https://t.co/e6wNaBN7on

Millions are sheltered in place & thousands who will become infected will die because the Trump Admin was too slow to take coronavirus seriously too reluctant to take the urgent actions necessary to secure critical medical supplies & totally unwilling to communicate honestly.

I'll be going live tomorrow on Facebook to answer your questions about Congress's response to the coronavirus epidemic. Reply with your questions! You can tune in here on Tuesday: https://t.co/v8VphmakQK https://t.co/lksXSH1Enq

I recorded this message before voting for the Coronavirus Aid Relief & Economic Security (CARES) Act to get critical resources to our health care providers and state governments on the frontlines of this crisis and relief to the families and small businesses who are struggling. https://t.co/soMlifhJg1
I hope you can join me on tonight's telephone town hall at 6:30pm CT. Register now to join the conversation on the coronavirus response.  Se puede participar en español!   https://t.co/XCFIqxicyX

Our communities are coming together during the coronavirus outbreak. Thank you to everyone who is giving blood adopting and fostering animals shopping for groceries and other medical supplies for their vulnerable neighbors and more. https://t.co/D4cV850RTy
Questions about what Gov. Pritzker’s stay-at-home order means for you?  See below for FAQs about how to comply to help Illinois slow the spread of coronavirus: https://t.co/pcVOla794J

A huge thank you to Highwood’s 28 Mile Distilling and all the other small businesses across Illinois who are shifting resources to help combat the coronavirus epidemic and to keep Americans working. https://t.co/jta4DIjlr6

We hosted a webinar this afternoon to discuss the resources available to small businesses navigating the coronavirus outbreak. If you missed it a recording is available on our YouTube page. Special thank you to our partners at @SBAgov and @ILSBDC!  https://t.co/MxlleycOOH

Looking for ways to give back to your community during the coronavirus epidemic?  The state of Illinois is coordinating donations of unopened personal protective equipment (PPE) like gloves and masks Learn more here: https://t.co/5qu2gX3mDp

Secretary Mnuchin just announced the IRS will extend the tax filing deadline until July 15 for all filers due to the coronavirus. Glad to see this action. It's the right decision for the reasons I outlined in my letter to the IRS earlier this week. https://t.co/npVtq9MvQL
Getting ready for our Telephone Town Hall to discuss the coronavirus. Join us at 7:00pm CT by calling 855-859-7337 or at https://t.co/XCFIqxicyX

I am glad the Senate has finally acted to pass the House's bipartisan package of economic security measures to help families facing the coronavirus including free testing expanded paid sick leave and strengthened unemployment insurance benefits. https://t.co/qnhL3qDEBh

I requested the IRS delay the April 15 tax filing deadline due to the coronavirus outbreak. I'm glad the IRS previously announced a 90 day extension of the deadline for tax payments but the filing deadline needs to be similarly extended. https://t.co/8JaFVQCuFO

I'm hosting a telephone town hall tomorrow Thursday March 19 at 7:00pm CT to discuss the coronavirus and our public health response.   Follow the link below to register to participate. I hope you'll join us!  https://t.co/XCFIqxicyX
Beware of scammers seeking to take advantage of concern over the coronavirus. The Federal Trade Commission has good tips on what to watch out for and how to protect yourself: https://t.co/qOBBT9XkAc
Our local food pantries are struggling to keep up during the coronavirus outbreak. If you can please consider supporting your area food bank during this difficult time. https://t.co/L4qFcfu6AU

Many blood drives have been cancelled due to the coronavirus outbreak and donors are urgently needed. Open donation sites have social distancing practices in place. If you are eligible and healthy please consider making an appointment at https://t.co/7znwfv4SId

We all have a role to play preventing the spread of coronavirus in our communities. These are good suggestions from Illinois Department of Public Health (@IDPH) on social distancing: https://t.co/UjUT5MQXex

To increase social distance I urge you to consider early voting which remains available today ahead of Tuesday's Mar. 17 primary election. 🗳️   Find your polling place & read the steps election officials are taking to help prevent spread of virus here:  https://t.co/5SM3znb6Qq

The Families First Coronavirus Response Act includes:  ✅ Free testing ✅ Paid emergency leave ✅ Expanded unemployment benefits and food assistance ✅ More funding for Medicaid  It is vitally important the Senate returns to Washington immediately to pass it without delay.

Late last night the House built on last week's $8.3b emergency public health supplemental  passing a bipartisan package with the support of the White House focused on Americans’ economic security during the coronavirus pandemic. https://t.co/H58zGIHamB

Today I announced our offices will begin serving constituents remotely and physical locations will be temporarily closed to most visitors in order to protect the public health and prevent the potential spread of coronavirus.  https://t.co/UypbWJgBBu
The Illinois Department of Public Health (@idph) has a hotline to answer questions about coronavirus COVID-19 symptoms testing and more:  Phone: 1-800-889-3931 Email: DPH.SICK@ILLINOIS.GOV
I wanted to share an update with you on coronavirus to explain what actions Congress has taken and where we go from here. https://t.co/UFae31KvuC

The coronavirus outbreak has the potential to disrupt America's small businesses which are the backbone of our economy. Today at @housesmallbiz we heard from business owners about how they're fairing and what Congress can do to help. https://t.co/Y2jKFZ6C8Z

To help prevent spread of coronavirus we are cleaning surfaces in our offices nightly with disinfectant. In addition:   - Avoid close contact with people who are sick. - Avoid touching your eyes nose and mouth - Wash your hands often with soap and water for at least 20 sec https://t.co/I4FWwft8yT

Today I called back some of the constituents who have written in over past week about coronavirus and shared details of the $8.3 billion package the House passed to address this public health threat. https://t.co/tZ1oqaRNK3

To best prevent the spread of #coronavirus here’s a few of the best tips from the CDC: -Avoid close touching your eyes nose & mouth -Stay home when you are sick -Wash your hands with soap and water for at least 20 seconds   And more: https://t.co/XPNAjv9xIB
The @HouseDemocrats’ #coronavirus package provides over $3 billion to help develop vaccines therapeutics and diagnostics to prevent or treat #COVID19 https://t.co/7c6DMwaooF

Today I voted to pass a bipartisan funding package to ensure our communities have the resources to prevent the spread of coronavirus and treat those who are affected. The Senate is expected to quickly take up this bill and send it to the President's desk. https://t.co/ckYfKZIFRr

The coronavirus outbreak is threatening the supply chain for medical devices we depend on to deliver life-saving care. Today I introduced bipartsian legislation with @congressmanhice and @janschakowsky to help FDA fight shortages of medical equipment such as respirator masks. https://t.co/XvQRp78HhM

Today I urged Sec. Mnuchin who is on the President's coronavirus task force to make public the timeframe for distributing critically-needed testing kits to our communities. Our public health officials need this equipment. https://t.co/FDtqKhOZk9
Good tips from @CDCgov on how to prevent transmission of the coronavirus and other respiratory diseases this flu-season. https://t.co/I609aotJUi
